RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the group members: Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez, Jaime Gomez-Arroyo, and seven other undocumented aliens

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero: Defendant involved in a case of reckless endangerment and death enhancements while transporting unlawful aliens into the United States, with a base offense level enhanced due to the death of Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez. Argued against sentence enhancement under reckless endangerment guideline. Provided inaccurate advice on journey length to the aliens. Transported illegal aliens for money, knowing they were illegal aliens. Guided individuals through the hot South Texas desert in the dead of summer. Contended that the district court erred in enhancing his base offense level eight levels for the death of Simon-Fernandez.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alma Delia Simon-Fernandez: Undocumented female alien who died due to heat stroke during transportation by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Herrera: court in the Ninth Circuit that addressed whether intent is required for an enhancement under a specific subsection and made a statement regarding causal connection between offense conduct and death or injury in a footnote. Found that no intent requirement is necessary for an enhancement under this subsection.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero, Alma Delia Si: Group of nine aliens guided by Inocencio Garcia-Guerrero for financial gain
